title.narrative: Envelope One: Enhancing access to dignified safer living conditions for IDPs through complementary life-saving dignified Shelter, WASH and FSL assistance

description.narrative: This project supports IDPs sites population in Dana and Maaret Tamsrin through Shelter, WASH and FSL interventions serving around 27,000 from the most vulnerable IDPs of men, women, boys and girls, (5,415 household) to improve the living conditions, basic services in the camps and providing access to clean drinking water. The shelter component will include installation of 118 dignified shelter units to replace old tents (according to Shelter cluster guidelines) in Maryam camp, people with disabilities (PwD) are taken into consideration by installing ramps where necessary, IDPs site improvement (gravelling, lighting, and rain drainage) will be implemented where necessary and applicable. Based on need, HiHFAD will deliver the necessary complementary services in pre-established dignified shelter IDPs sites such as execution of gravelling and lighting in other camps in Dana subdistrict which are already made from bricks and plastic roofs. To enhance access to clean water, maximize the impact of the project and reduce water-borne and related diseases, WaSH intervention will be implemented as a complementary component in the project target areas by extension and rehabilitation of WASH infrastructure (water network and water station) through rehabilitation of " Kan Safra Station" to construct water network in three camps and connecting them to the mentioned water station through climate friendly solution by installing solar power system to operate the pumping station. 3 camps will also benefit from operation of Al ahmar water station (that has been rehabilitated under 3rd reserved allocation 2021 on solar power. Water quality will be ensured, and water will be chlorinated with FRC between 0.2 - 0.5. in addition, internal sewage system in Maryam camp will be constructed, the WASH component will provide full WaSH package including solid waste management, desludging and conducting hygiene promotion campaigns focusing on water borne disease and personal hygiene. It aims to ensure that IDPs in the targeted locations can maintain or improve their hygiene behaviors. People with disabilities will be taken into consideration to ensure that they benefit from the activities, where garbage containers will be near them, while the pumping of water will reach all people in the target area including PWD. And to improve food security as one of the most urgent needs of the most vulnerable communities under this allocation, HIHFAD will purchase 650 MT of wheat from up to 650 farmers from the ongoing project SCHF project 18346 in Al Rouge Plain, 215 MT of Durum wheat and 435 MT of soft wheat which will be processed into 482.5 MT of wheat flour that will be produced via contracting local bakeries to be distributed as a fresh bread bundles (1 KG) to about 2500 IDPs HHs using in-kind modality in 10 camps including Maryam camp and in locations that are served with dignified shelter , this component will have the life-saving theme as it will target the IDPs in camps of the targeted sub-district through 6 months of distribution for 26 days per month based on vulnerability selection criteria and service coverage from other NGOs.
